Let's put our numbers into a place value table.

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
- | :-: | :-: | :-:
$\maroonD{45}$ |  | $\maroonD4$ | $\maroonD5$
$\blueE{917}$ | $\blueE9$ | $\blueE1$ | $\blueE7$

Now, we can break apart each number by place value.

$\maroonD{45}=\maroonD{4\text{ tens}} + \maroonD{5\text{ ones}}$.  

$\blueE{917}=\blueE{9\text{ hundreds}} + \blueE{1\text{ ten}} + \blueE{7\text{ ones}}$.
$9\text{ hundreds} + 4 \text{ tens}+1\text{ ten} +5 \text{ ones}+7 \text{ ones}$ is the same as $45 + 917$.
